TopicTitle: Fastest single jet engine under 25.000 meters 1.0.3.

Articles.Content:
**Mission:**

-Build a plane with a single jet engine (**J33-TurboJet-Rapier**).

-Put a \*notsostupid\* **Kerbal** (or 2) in it.

-Take off from the runway.

-Go as fast as you can, but **stay under** 25.000 meters.

-Don't explode, **don't lose** any parts.

-Return to the runway and land safe (**close** to the runway is also ok). 

-Prove you did this by **screenshots (F3)**

-No mods, no overclipping !

\*I will **only** use info displayed on **F3 screen !**

**Reward:**

-Good feeling ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

-A batch if someone will design them.

**LEADERBOARD**

**J33** 

1. T3hJimmer **717** m/s 

2.

2.

**Turbojet** 

1. ExalterDuck **1.485** m/s

2. T3hJimmer **1.427** m/s

3.

**Rapier**

1. ExalterDuck **1.741** m/s

 2. Xannari Ferrows **1.715** m/s

3. Triop **1.614** m/s

4.

5.

**GOOD LUCK !**

I will only use info displayed on F3 screen, I know it's not exactly accurate but this way it's fair for everybody...

triop, just FYI, the "highest speed over land" IS accurate. the reason it is different from highest shown surface speed is because surface velocity also takes into account vertical speed, not just horiz. speed.

> 
> triop, just FYI, the "highest speed over land" IS accurate. the reason it is different from highest shown surface speed is because surface velocity also takes into account vertical speed, not just horiz. speed.

I know, I meant to say that, It's just my poor English...Thanks.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-26T17:34:16Z" title="06/26/2015 05:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 26, 2015</time> by ihtoit**

@ ihtoit,

Nice, what game is that ? (just joking ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

I just want this challenge to be for people who like to play without mods, feel free to start your own challenge.

problem is you can't get much above 1400m/s without stock wings exploding. What went on my jet wasn't the wings (Firespitter), it was the jet engine - straight and level, undocumented but take my word I was doing 1445 level at 14km, when it went it broke the tailplane sending that into the wings. If I'd had say the FS ramjet (faster spool-up, better gimbal for pitch authority and slightly less thrust than the stock turbojet) fitted, that wouldn't have happened.

(BTW the shock cone intake is useless for this challenge. It likes to explode a LOT).

> 
> problem is you can't get much above 1400m/s without stock wings exploding.

These men did it:

1. ExalterDuck **1.485** m/s

2. T3hJimmer **1.427** m/s

> 
> And this happened:

my advice for next time: lockwashers, double nuts, and whole lot of loc tite. ;p

> 
> problem is you can't get much above 1400m/s without stock wings exploding.

 too fast, too low. If I dived sharp enough to avoid seeing a heating gauge, I might as well have been hitng the ground at around 16000m. No warning. just boom.

> 
> (BTW the shock cone intake is useless for this challenge. It likes to explode a LOT).

This just gave me an idea for a new mkII design. >=]
